document_data.name: Solid Cloud
document_data.refs2e: <ref name=ALAY-p24">{{Cite organized play/LC/Air's Looking at You|24}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Solid cloud''''' was an [[alteration]] [[spell]],<ref name=ALAY-p24" /> developed by the [[air]] [[elementalist]] [[Mortimer Lightfoot]] in the mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]],<ref name=ALAY-p16">{{Cite organized play/LC/Air's Looking at You|16}} that allowed a caster to make a single cloud tangible.<ref name=ALAY-p24" />
document_data.Effects: Upon having ''solid cloud'' cast on it, a cloud was capable of being walked on and supporting objects as if it were solid ground. When interacted with, a cloud had a [[cotton]]y and soft touch. This effect was permanent.<ref name=ALAY-p24" />
document_data.Components: In addition to requiring [[somatic]] and [[verbal component]]s, ''solid cloud'' required a [[material component]], which took the form of the cloud that was to be used by the spell.<ref name=ALAY-p24" />
document_data.History: In the mid–14{{th}} century DR, Mortimer Lightfoot and a group of other rogue elementalists known as the [[Circle of Four]] used ''solid cloud'', alongside Mortimer's other spell ''[[cloud shape]]'', to create a sort of [[cloud palace]] that they used to imprison their kidnapped victims.<ref name=ALAY-p16" />
